page.title: 08NEW HALL MILL SUTTON C'FLD
page.content: {Medieval}New Hall is the oldest residential building in Sutton Coldfield.It is situated in the{Plants {Brook Valley.}Some of the land has recently been sold for housing. Proposals have been made to change the Hall into a{hotel,}to cater for visitors to the National Exhibition Centre and the Belfry Golf Course. The Civic Society has not opposed this change-if it means the survival of an otherwise threatened building. Nearby is the{17th Century water } {mill}which formerly ground corn from the estate.The mill was driven by an overshot wheel.Now it is just an unusual residence.It is ironic that to drive the mill today,water must be pumped by the electricity board.The mill is{held in trust}to protect part of our heritage for the appreciation of future generations.
